intro: Jasione montana var. imbricans, commonly known as the mountain jasione, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are basal, linear to lanceolate, and often covered in fine hairs. The flowers, which are usually pink to purple, bloom in early summer and attract various pollinators.
